citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Female dog #046's left eye was swollen and red and dry on the surface with dry material on the surface. Her right eye had
an uneven surface and was gray on the surface. These are signs of active eye problems and could cause discomfort.
These eye problems have not been under treatment at the time of inspection. Ensure that this dog is evaluated by the
attending veterinarian (or a qualified licensed veterinarian) to ensure that appropriate treatment can be started for this
dog.
***Correct by 8/23/2025.

A written exercise program that is approved by the attending veterinarian was not available. A written program for
exercise that is approved by the attending veterinarian is required and helps ensure dogs have adequate space and
exercise. Ensure that a written program for veterinary care is approved by the AV and is maintained available for
inspection.
***Correct prior to next site approval inspection.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Female dog #046's left eye was swollen and red and dry on the surface with dry material on the surface. Her right eye had 
an uneven surface and was gray on the surface. These are signs of active eye problems and could cause discomfort. 
These eye problems have not been under treatment at the time of inspection. Ensure that this dog is evaluated by the 
attending veterinarian (or a qualified licensed veterinarian) to ensure that appropriate treatment can be started for this 
dog.  
***Correct by 8/23/2025. 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
A written exercise program that is approved by the attending veterinarian was not available. A written program for 
exercise that is approved by the attending veterinarian is required and helps ensure dogs have adequate space and 
exercise. Ensure that a written program for veterinary care is approved by the AV and is maintained available for 
inspection.  
***Correct prior to next site approval inspection. 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection.  
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License. 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection. 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
